alert.note: Alert for Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 11 at 7:58PM CDT until September 11 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Nolan County in west central Texas... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 757 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Champion, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Nolan County, including the following locations... Us-84 Near The Nolan-Fisher County Line and I-20 Near The Nolan-Mitchell County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 229 and 237. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
